description.text: IOA YANG model associated with Time Management, including time objects, clock and NTP.
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R6.0
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R5.1
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R5.0
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R4.1
System clock.
Indicates the current Date and Time of this NE.
Indicates the UTC Date and Time of this NE.
Indicates the Name of the Time Zone of this NE.
Indicates how long the system has been running.
Indicates that NE uses NTP for synchronization.
indicates that NE uses NE internal clock for Synchronization.
Indicates the source of the system current time.
Whether daylight saving is active.
Indicates last system time jump in the format '<time1> to <time2>'. Time jumps of less than 10 seconds are ignored.
Network Time Protocol Configuration
Network Time Protocol Configuration.
Whether ntp is enabled.
Whether NTP authentication is enabled.
Currently active NTP server.
Keys to be used for NTP authentication.
NTP Key-ID.
Use sha-1 hash algorithm for NTP message digest computation
Use AES-CMAC hash algorithm for NTP message digest computation
Use sha-256 hash algorithm for NTP message digest computation
Use md5 hash algorithm for NTP message digest computation
Hash algorithm for NTP message digest computation
NTP Key-value.
Is trusted NTP key.
Configured NTP server.
NTP Server IP address. Ipv4/Ipv6/hostname supported.
Indicates NTP address has been manually configured.

Indicates NTP address that has been assigned to this
system by a DHCP server.

NTP address assignment method, user can convert
DHCP configured NTP entry into a manual configured by changing this attribute.
Key ID to be used for this server.
NTP server status.
Reference clock type or address for the peer.
Indicates the stratum of the remote peer.
Type of the peer ('l' for local reference clock, 'u' for unicast, 'm' for multicast or 'b' for broadcast)
Indicates time elapsed since last packet was received in seconds.
Indicates the polling interval in seconds.

Indicates the reachability of the configured server.
This is an 8-bit shift register with the most recent probe in the 2^0 position.
The value 377 indicates that all the recent probes have been answered.
Delay along path to the server in milliseconds.
Offset of clock to the peer in milliseconds.
Jitter along path to the server in milliseconds.
Authentication status of NTP server
Condition of NTP server. Some of possible values: sys.peer/reject/candidate/...
